title: "Week 7: Data Ethics & Responsible Visualization"

::: {.week-card}
## Overview
This week we'll examine the ethical dimensions of data visualization, including bias, misleading representations, privacy concerns, and our responsibilities as data storytellers. We'll learn to create honest and inclusive visualizations.
:::

## Learning Objectives

By the end of this week, you will be able to:

- Identify common ways visualizations can mislead
- Recognize and address bias in data representation
- Apply inclusive design principles to visualizations
- Consider privacy and consent in data visualization
- Create ethical guidelines for your visualization practice

## Readings

### Required
- Cairo, A. (2019). *How Charts Lie*, Chapters 1-3
- D'Ignazio, C. & Klein, L. (2020). *Data Feminism*, Chapter 6: "The Numbers Don't Speak for Themselves"

### Optional
